DOC.brief_summary: DHA , type fatty acid , important early development , term reproductive physiology gestation postnatal behavioral cognitive function . In adult , DHA show low triglyceride important cardiovascular health autonomic control , lower heart rate blood pressure increase heart variability . Little known fatty acid impact cardiac control infant , child fetus . Our hypothesis maternal DHA supplementation ( 600 mg/day ) low fetal HR increase fetal HRV .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Docosahexaenoic Acid ( DHA ) Fetal Cardiac Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: We observe maternal DHA supplementation pregnancy result low fetal heart rate ( HR ) high heart-rate variability ( HRV ) . In another study , find infant DHA supplement formula lower HR . Because DHA supplementation infancy associate improved neurobehavioral outcome infant low HR high vagal control find improved developmental outcome , first aim conduct randomize , placebo-controlled trial determine whether maternal DHA supplementation pregnancy result low HR high HRV fetal period . We document fetal neurobehaviors ( body breathe movement ) hallmarks fetal well-being influence HR HRV .
